intro: Phenax ternata, commonly known as the three-leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
